data.name: ActivatedMessageHtml.Text
data.value: Premium Data is active. Thank you.

data.name: ActivateInstructionsHtml.Text
data.value:
Activate All Features

Step 1 - Obtain a 51Degrees on premise license key.


Step 2 - Paste your license key into the text box below and then select "Activate" to use the license key with this site.

data.name: ActivationDataInvalidHtml.Text
data.value: The data source provided does not contain valid data.

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotUpdateConfigHtml.Text
data.value:
The fiftyOne/detection element of the config file '{1}' could not be inserted. Please ensure the following text is present between the fiftyOne tags and try activating the license key again.


<detection binaryFilePath="~/App_Data/51Degrees-Premium.dat"/>

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotWriteDataFileHtml.Text
data.value: The device data file '{1}' could not be saved. Check the user '{2}' has write access to the folder, or change the folder location to one with write access.

data.name: ActivationFailureCouldNotWriteLicenceFileHtml.Text
data.value: The license file '{1}' could not be written to this site's bin folder '{2}'. Create a text file with the extension .lic and paste the license key into the file. Save the text file in the bin folder.

data.name: ActivationFailureGenericHtml.Text
data.value: Whoops. There was a problem activating the license key. We're unsure why the license key provided could not be activated. Please Contact Us providing details of your site implementation and we'll try and help you.

data.name: ActivationFailureHttpHtml.Text
data.value:
We were unable to reach the 51Degrees.mobi license validation site at the host '{1}'. This could be for one of the following reasons.

  • This site is running in medium trust mode and the originUrl attribute in the web.config does not allow access to the host '{1}'. Change the originUrl to include '{1}'. Multiple host names can be separated by | signs.
  • The web servers firewall or another firewall is blocking access to the host or the SSL port 443. Check the firewall configuration.

When you've completed these checks try activating the license key again.

data.name: ActivationFailureInvalidHtml.Text
data.value: The license key provided failed validation. Please check the license key is validate with your reseller.

data.name: ActivationStreamFailureHtml.Text
data.value: The data source provided could not be read from.

data.name: ActivationSuccessHtml.Text
data.value: Success. Select the "Refresh" button to reload the web page and start using Premium Device Data. Note: There may be a short delay while the application restarts.

data.name: NoResultsFound.Text
data.value: There were no results found matching your search.

data.name: PremiumIntro.Text
data.value: The {0} data contains thousands of devices, including games consoles, eBook readers, tablets, smart phones and feature phones. Each device is associated with a wide range of relevant properties, from screen size and input methods to operating system, browser and hardware.

data.name: RefreshButtonText.Text
data.comment: Used to reload page after upgrade to premium.

data.name: ValidationFileErrorText.Text
data.value: Use the Browse button to select a Premium data file to upload.

data.name: ValidationRequiredErrorText.Text
data.value: A license key must be entered.

data.name: ValidationRegExErrorText.Text
data.value: The license key must only contain upper case alpha characters or numerics.

data.name: PremiumUploadError.Text
data.value: There was a problem uploading your data.

data.name: SettingsAutoUpdates.Help
data.value: Check this box to automatically update the device data file. When enabled the site will check 51Degrees for new versions of the device data file and automatically apply them without recycling the application domain. Enhanced data is needed to support this option.

data.name: SettingsEnabled.Help
data.value: Check this box to enable device detection.

data.name: SettingsShareUsage.Help
data.value: Check this box to share usage data with 51Degrees.

data.name: DeviceBrowserUnavailable.Html
data.value:
The device data set being used for device detection does not include sufficient information about web enabled devices to support the device explorer tab.

Devices available in the enhanced versions of device detection can be explored on the 51Degrees site.

data.name: ManualUpdates.Help
data.value: Upload new device data set files manually.

data.name: SettingsDataSetDeviceCombinations.Help
data.value: The number of combinations of device, operating system and web browsers this site can detect.

data.name: SettingsDataSetHardwareProfiles.Help
data.value: The number of different web enabled device models this site can currently detect.

data.name: SettingsDataSetName.Help
data.value: Either Lite, Premium or Enterprise depending on the active 51Degrees data set. Lite is provided with DNN Platform and Premium data comes with DNN Evoq. DNN Platform can be upgraded with a licence key.

data.name: SettingsDataSetNextUpdate.Help
data.value: When the next data set is expected to be available from 51Degrees.

data.name: SettingsDataSetPropertyCount.Help
data.value: The number of properties available in the active data set.

data.name: SettingsDataSetPublished.Help
data.value: Date the active data set was published by 51Degrees.

data.name: SettingsDataSetVersion.Help
data.value: The version format of the device data file.

data.name: SettingsRefresh.Help
data.value: When device detection is used with Evoq or enhanced 51Degrees device data this option checks for a new version of device data at 51Degrees.

data.name: SettingsUpload.Help
data.value: Upload a 51Degrees data file for use with device detection. New data files can be obtained directly from 51Degrees.

data.name: GetStartedIntro.Html
data.value:
Client side responsive web design (RWD) involves sending all content to the browser and letting the browser resize and adjust for the device. The 51Degrees Client Capability Provider enables the option to control content server side including sending different images, navigation and content to different device types. This reduces page weight to mobile improving performance, presents an optimised user interface, ultimately enhancing the user's experience.

Over 85% of blue chip companies use device detection, including eCommerce, Media, AdTech, Finance and Travel sectors. Read more for case studies and ideas.

Read More

data.name: SettingsChangeError.Text
data.value: The device detection settings could not be changed. Check the 51Degrees.mobi.config file for modify permissions and recycle the application domain.

data.name: SettingsChangeSuccess.Text
data.value: Device detection settings have been updated. Recycle the application domain for the changes to take effect.

data.name: SettingsImageOptimiser.Help
data.value: When image optimizer AND device detection are enabled DNN will not send images to devices that are too large for their screens to display. Query string parameters can be added to image URLs to automatically size images to improve performance.

data.name: SettingsFactory.Help
data.value: The type of data management method in use. Stream uses less memory but is slower. Memory is faster but uses more memory.

data.name: SettingsFileMode.Help
data.value: The bulk of the device data is retained on the file system. Small portions are loaded into memory when needed. Reduces memory consumption. When disabled memory mode is used where the device data file is loaded into memory. File mode uses the least amount of memory.

data.name: GetStartedDetail.Html
data.value:
Image Optimisation

Ensure precisely sized images are sent to web pages by adding querystring parameters to image URLs to return precisely sized images for the screen. For example; <img src="Empty.gif" data-src="/image.png?w=auto"/> or /DesktopModules/Admin/FiftyOneClientCapabilityProvider/Images/Optimization.png?w=300

Images larger than the device screen will automatically be shrunk before sending.

Device Detection

For Web Administrators

  • Retain desktop optimized content such as Flash or big screen videos on the same page as smartphone and tablet content.
  • Use hover mega menus to optimize rapid navigation for mouse and keyboard whilst using a responsive menu for touch screens.
  • Redirect users to optimized pages for Smartphones and Tablets.
  • Enhance Google Analytics with information about screen size and input methods.

For Developers

  • Turn page content on and off based on server side rules. For example; Request.Browser["IsTablet"] to understand if the requesting device is a tablet.
  • Access device capabilities from JavaScript with http://HOSTNAME/51Degrees.features.js
